IdentificationModule.BriefTitle: Omic Technologies to Track Resistance to Palbociclib in Metastatic Breast Cancer
IdentificationModule.OfficialTitle: Omic Technologies to Track Resistance to Palbociclib in Metastatic Breast Cancer (OMERIC): A Cohort Study

DescriptionModule.BriefSummary: This is a monocentric cohort study, prospective and interventional with minimal risks and constraints for advanced breast cancer. The planned interventions are collection of biological samples at different times. The study will aim to do a descriptive analysis of omics profiles evolution (tumor, volatile organic components) over time, before and after disease progression under Palbociclib treatment with a clinical-biological database.
DescriptionModule.DetailedDescription:
Patients enrolled in the study will receive the following interventions:

Biospecimen sample collection: before and during treatment, and at progression
Tumor biopsy before treatment and at progression

The aim of this study is to describe molecular changes associated with resistance to Palbociclib at the individual level and describe longitudinal changes in the profile of tumor, VOCs and exosomes according to treatment response.

Other objectives of the study include:

Proportion of single or shared molecular alterations / signatures between patients at progression time
Associations between tumor signatures, VOCs and exosomes
Compare molecular changes identified by proteomics with those observed by genomics / transcriptomics
Compare the evolution of VOCs and exosomes over time with evolution of liquid biopsy markers.

Intervention.InterventionDescription:
Before and during treatment, and at progression, collection of :

Blood
Exhaled air
Saliva
Sweat
Tears
Urine

PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeMeasure: Intrapatient variation in molecular profiles at progression compared to baseline
PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeDescription: Variation over time in the rate of VOCs in response to treatment and in progression situations.
PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeTimeFrame: From date of inclusion until the date of first documented progression (around 2 years)

PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeMeasure: longitudinal changes in VOCs profile and exosomes according to response to treatment
PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeDescription: variation over time in exosomes count in response to treatment and in progression situations
PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeTimeFrame: From date of inclusion until the date of first documented progression, assessed up to 2 years

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Proportion of alterations / molecular signatures unique or shared between patients at progression
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: Frequency of molecular alterations in the population
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: At progression time, up to 2 years

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Correlation between tumor signatures, VOCs and exosomes
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: Distribution of VOCs and exosome profiles according to the different molecular profiles of tumors that will be identified
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: At progression time, up to 2 years

OtherOutcome.OtherOutcomeMeasure: Concordance between molecular changes identified by proteomics and those observed by genomics/transcriptomics
OtherOutcome.OtherOutcomeDescription: Concordance between identified proteins and expressed genes and/or detected mutations
OtherOutcome.OtherOutcomeTimeFrame: At progression time, up to 2 years

OtherOutcome.OtherOutcomeMeasure: Describe the evolution of VOCs and exosomes over time in relation to the evolution of liquid biopsy markers (CA15.3)
OtherOutcome.OtherOutcomeDescription: Intra-patient variation over time in VOC rate (rate of CA15.3)
OtherOutcome.OtherOutcomeTimeFrame: At progression time, up to 2 years

OtherOutcome.OtherOutcomeMeasure: Describe the evolution of VOCs and exosomes over time in relation to the evolution of liquid biopsy markers (CA15.3)
OtherOutcome.OtherOutcomeDescription: Intra-patient variation over time in exosomes count (rate of CA15.3)
OtherOutcome.OtherOutcomeTimeFrame: At progression time, up to 2 years

OtherOutcome.OtherOutcomeMeasure: Describe the evolution of VOCs and exosomes over time in relation to the evolution of liquid biopsy markers (CA15.3)
OtherOutcome.OtherOutcomeDescription: Intra-patient variation over time in liquid biopsy markers (rate of CA15.3)
OtherOutcome.OtherOutcomeTimeFrame: At progression time, up to 2 years

OtherOutcome.OtherOutcomeMeasure: Describe the evolution of VOCs and exosomes over time in relation to the evolution of liquid biopsy markers (LDH)
OtherOutcome.OtherOutcomeDescription: Intra-patient variation over time in VOC rate (rate of LDH)
OtherOutcome.OtherOutcomeTimeFrame: At progression time, up to 2 years

OtherOutcome.OtherOutcomeMeasure: Describe the evolution of VOCs and exosomes over time in relation to the evolution of liquid biopsy markers (LDH)
OtherOutcome.OtherOutcomeDescription: Intra-patient variation over time in exosomes count (rate of LDH)
OtherOutcome.OtherOutcomeTimeFrame: At progression time, up to 2 years

OtherOutcome.OtherOutcomeMeasure: Describe the evolution of VOCs and exosomes over time in relation to the evolution of liquid biopsy markers (LDH)
OtherOutcome.OtherOutcomeDescription: Intra-patient variation over time in liquid biopsy markers (rate of LDH)
OtherOutcome.OtherOutcomeTimeFrame: At progression time, up to 2 years

EligibilityModule.EligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

Women over 18 years old
With histologically proven breast cancer, positives hormones receptors and negative HER2
Advanced disease (metastases or non-resequable locoregional disease), from the 1st to the 4th line.
With an indication for hormone therapy associated with the CDK4/6 inhibitor Palbociclib
Agree to the sampling of the study
Signed the informed consent form

Exclusion Criteria:

Neoadjuvant or adjuvant treatment for localized breast cancer
Metastatic breast cancer beyond the forth line
Impossibility to give informed consent (person deprived of liberty or under guardianship)
